comments.body:
```suggestion
  } extends Product with Serializable
```
I'm fairly sure @S11001001 wrote about it but I couldn't find his post, [this](https://typelevel.org/blog/2018/05/09/product-with-serializable.html) is what I found. No need to accept this if you don't think it adds anything here.
I know about the pattern but I usually add it only when I actually use it in a way where type inference benefits from it. But I guess there is no harm in adding it prematurely.

comments.body: I think I asked you this before but I forgot: Why do you prefer `abstract class` over `trait`?

> it is a simple pattern to avoid multi-intermittency

The best reason. It's like not using `var` when `val` will do.
seems reasonable, thanks for the explanation
This is the visibility check for contract keys, right? I don't see any corresponding visibility check for contracts in this PR, is that by design?
The visibility check for contract lookups happens in `lookupGlobalContract` via the `visibleIn` method of `ParticipantView` which did get modified in this PR.
Ah I see :+1:
Should we attach a ticket to this so we don't forget it?
You canâ€™t implement multi-party submissions without this so I donâ€™t think there is any danger of forgetting this.

Wasn't `cb` clear enough? ðŸ˜‰
Did you figure out what it stands for?
`callback` presumably but that isnâ€™t much more useful than `cb` so Iâ€™ve renamed it to what it actually does :slightly_smiling_face:
Yeah, `callback` sounds very reasonable. Thanks. I haven't done enough JS yet to make the word omnipresent in my head. And I agree that `callback` carries almost as little information as `cb`.
I don't see a consequence for this match branch.

This is legal scala syntax. It means the same as having `()` on RHS of the `=>`
It's used all over the scala code base.
But I agree, I generally prefer when code is explicit with `()`, but I missed it here.
Since that code has changed anyway, can we please add the `()` here.
ok
